Question: Passengers in your vehicle are 15 years or over. Who is responsible for making sure they wear a safety belt (seat belt)?

Answers.Answer: The passengers themselves
The parents of the passengers
You as the driver of the vehicle
Other passengers in your vehicle

Question: What does this traffic signal mean?

Answers.Answer: Drive on before the signal changes to red
Drive on because the signal will turn green
Stop if you can do so safely
Stop only if traffic is in the way

Answers.Answer: The child’s parents
The driver of the vehicle
The owner of the vehicle
The child

A doctor
A member of the public
A police officer

Give way to pedestrians on the other side of the road

Drive on as pedestrians will give way to all on coming traffic

Question: When driving on an unlaned road, where should your vehicle be positioned?

Answers.Answer: Anywhere, so long as you can see what is coming
1 metre from the left-hand kerb
Close to the centre of the road
As close to the left side of the road as possible

Question: What should you do if the vehicle behind you wishes to pass?

Answers.Answer: Move to the centre so that they cannot pass
Speed up so that they will not need to pass
Move as far to the left side of the road as is safe
Slow down and signal right.

Question: If you have had a flat tyre and have fitted a ‘space saver wheel’ what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive normally
Drive directly to a place where the flat tyre can be repaired and replaced
Drive at 40km/h until the flat tyre has been repaired
Lower the pressure in the other tyres

Question: You look in the mirror and see a cyclist – what should you do when opening the car door?

Answers.Answer: Open the door and expect the cyclist to stop
Open the door and expect the cyclist to swerve
Wait for the cyclist to go past before opening the door
Warn the cyclist by sounding the horn before opening the door

Question: How can small amounts of alcohol affect your driving?

Answers.Answer: You can judge your speed more easily
Your driving improves
It will alter your senses
Your driving reactions will be quicker

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: There has been a crash – slow down to 20km/h when passing this sign until you have passed the crash
There have been crashes here in the past – slow down
There has been a crash – but the road is clear now
This is an accident black spot

Question: What should you do when another vehicle is following you very closely?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get further ahead
Brake suddenly to warn them
Flick your vehicle lights and wave your arm
Slow down, move to the left and allow the vehicle to pass

Question: When passing a horse and rider, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Warn the rider by sounding the horn on your vehicle
Slow down and give them as much room as you can
Speed up
Warn the rider by turning your vehicle headlights on

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: You may park your vehicle within the next 40 metres of the sign

Question: Which parts of the car must be in good condition to prevent too much noise and gases entering the car?

Answers.Answer: Good mud guards and mud flaps
A good silencer and exhaust system

Question: You wish to make a right turn on a narrow country road. There is a vehicle coming towards you and traffic behind you. What is the safest option?

Answers.Answer: Wait in the centre of the road and turn when it is clear
Drive straight ahead and do a U-turn when the road is clear
